title: Roberto Olayo Alarcon
text:
Hi there! My name is Roberto. I am a PhD student at Ludwig-Maximilians-Universität München and the Helmholtz Munich under the supervision of Christian L. Müller.
Much of my research consists of using statistics and machine learning to gain new insights into biological systems. I particularly look into subjects related to antimicrobial resistance, and deep unsupervised learning.
Take a look at some of my projects and posters

text:

title: Projects
text: Here are some of the things I am working on at the moment.

title: Projects
text:
StressRegNet

This is the main project driving my PhD research. Here, we aim to identify chemical stressors and the bacterial regulatory pathways that control host adaptation and antibiotic sensitivity. By using a high-throughput chemical genomics approach, we will explore chemical stimuli from the host environment that induce stress response pathways in Salmonella and Campylobacter, and elucidate the underlying molecular crosstalk between sensory pathways of these microbes.
This project is part of the bavarian Bayresq research consortium, and is done in close colaboration with members of Dr. Cynthia Sharma and Dr. Ana Rita Brochado research groups.

title: Projects
section: StressRegNet - Bacterial response to chemical stress
text:
StressRegNet - Bacterial response to chemical stress

This is the main project driving my PhD research. Here, we aim to identify stressors and bacterial regulatory pathways that control host adaptation and antibiotic sensitivity. By using a high-throughput chemical genomics approach, we will explore chemical stimuli from the host environment that induce stress response pathways in Salmonella and Campylobacter, and elucidate the underlying molecular crosstalk between sensory pathways of these microbes.
This project is part of the bavarian Bayresq research consortium, and is done in close colaboration with members of Dr. Cynthia Sharma and Dr. Ana Rita Brochado research groups.

title: Projects
text:
Comparing Musical taste with Spotify.

Have you ever wondered what makes your taste in music unique to that of all your friends? You can check out some exploratory analysis I made comparing my music taste to that of some of my friends! Music taste analysis
